content.en: Electrostatic protein modeling: Scientists have developed various algorithms to address research questions related to the treatment of electrostatic effects in proteins and the efficient solution of the Poisson-Boltzmann equation. These algorithms include a multigrid-based Newton iterative method, a rapid multigrid-based Newton algorithm, a fast boundary element method, and an efficient implementation of the finite difference Poisson-Boltzmann solvent model. These advancements aim to accelerate Poisson-Boltzmann calculations for both static and dynamic systems, solve the equation for large biomolecular systems, and compute electrostatic forces between solvated molecules.
content.da: Elektrostatisk proteinmodellering: Forskere har udviklet forskellige algoritmer til at tackle forskningsspørgsmål relateret til behandlingen af elektrostatisk virkning i proteiner og den effektive løsning af Poisson-Boltzmann-ligningen. Disse algoritmer inkluderer en multigrid-baseret Newton-iterationsmetode, en hurtig multigrid-baseret Newton-algoritme, en hurtig grænseelementmetode og en effektiv implementering af den endelige forskel Poisson-Boltzmann-opløsningsmodel. Disse fremskridt sigter mod at fremskynde Poisson-Boltzmann-beregninger for både statiske og dynamiske systemer, løse ligningen for store biomolekylære systemer og beregne elektrostatisk kræfter mellem opløste molekyler.
